docs.snippet: Ho Jun Li, a soldier in the North Korean Army, won the gold medal in the small-bore, rifle shooting prone position yesterday at the Olympic Games in Munich, West Germany, and then stirred up a controversy by attempting to explain his victory at a...
docs.lead_paragraph: Ho Jun Li, a soldier in the North Korean Army, won the gold medal in the small-bore, rifle shooting prone position yesterday at the Olympic Games in Munich, West Germany, and then stirred up a controversy by attempting to explain his victory at a press conference.
docs.abstract: Ho Jun Li (N Korea) wins gold medal in small-bore rifle shooting on Aug 28

docs.snippet: Tupamaro founder R Sendic is shot and captured, Sept 2, in Montevideo area; Govt announcement says 2 other guerrillas found with him surrendered but Sendic reptdly resisted and was shot in head in gunfight that ensued; condition reptd critical; since...
docs.abstract: Tupamaro founder R Sendic is shot and captured, Sept 2, in Montevideo area; Govt announcement says 2 other guerrillas found with him surrendered but Sendic reptdly resisted and was shot in head in gunfight that ensued; condition reptd critical; since mid-Apr, when Uruguayan Army joined police to fight guerrilla movement, over 1,000 Tupamaros have been captured and hundreds of weapons have been seized; Sendic biog sketch

docs.snippet: BOGOTA, Colombia -- There are two kinds of governments in South America: those chosen by voters and those imposed by the military. Today, the largest countries in both camps -- Colombia and Brazil -- are also showing the most impressive economic...
docs.lead_paragraph: BOGOTA, Colombia -- There are two kinds of governments in South America: those chosen by voters and those imposed by the military. Today, the largest countries in both camps -- Colombia and Brazil -- are also showing the most impressive economic gains.
docs.abstract: Colombian and Brazilian economies compared in govt philosophies, one advocating dem ways and the other favoring totalitarianism; Colombian econ growth, now competing with that of Brazil, seen proving that dictatorship is not the only path toward impressive development

headline.main: Colombia Nudging Brazil In Economic Leadership; COLOMBIA SHOWS ECONOMIC GAINS

byline.original: By H. J. MAIDENBERGSpecial to The New York Times

docs.snippet: Just when it appeared that tennis royalty had regained the upper hand, anarchy broke out again yesterday at Forest Hills.
docs.lead_paragraph: Just when it appeared that tennis royalty had regained the upper hand, anarchy broke out again yesterday at Forest Hills.

headline.main: RICHEY PUTS OUT LAVER IN 4 SETS AT FOREST HILLS; Third-Seeded Aussie Plays With Back Brace -- Gimeno Nearly Upsets Smith

docs.snippet: Uruguyan Central Bank announces on Sept 8 that it has devalued peso to 627 per US dollar
docs.abstract: Uruguyan Central Bank announces on Sept 8 that it has devalued peso to 627 per US dollar

docs.snippet: The recent news of the capture of Raul Sendic, the Tupamaro urban guerrilla leader in Uruguay, may lead some to imagine that at last law and order is returning to that small Latin American nation. Such is not the truth It may he that the Tupamaro...
docs.lead_paragraph: The recent news of the capture of Raul Sendic, the Tupamaro urban guerrilla leader in Uruguay, may lead some to imagine that at last law and order is returning to that small Latin American nation. Such is not the truth It may he that the Tupamaro rebellion is disintegrating, but the major reality in today's Uruguay is a massive Government repression which violates basic human rights in a most brutal manner.
docs.abstract: Lr by E L Stockwell, member of United Methodist Bd of Missions, details evidences of repression of human rights in Uruguay found by mission of World Council of Churches in June '72; scores US support of Uruguayan Govt with mil and econ aid

headline.main: Edwin C. Wilson, 79, Is Dead; Ambassador to Turkey in 1940's

byline.original: Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: MENDHAM -- For potential executives of the Boy Scouts from the world over, all roads wind initially toward the Schiff Scout Reservation -- 508 acres of gentle, wooded hillsides surrounding this Morris County town.
docs.lead_paragraph: MENDHAM -- For potential executives of the Boy Scouts from the world over, all roads wind initially toward the Schiff Scout Reservation -- 508 acres of gentle, wooded hillsides surrounding this Morris County town.
docs.abstract: Scouts hold intensive training and instruction sessions for future leaders in Schiff Scout Reservation, Mendham, NJ; trainees from all over world share remedies for problems of their respective councils; program described

headline.main: Meanwhile, Boy Scouts Are Training Future Leaders

byline.original: Special to The New York Times
